TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed BitmapEffectInput extends System.Windows.Media.Animation.Animatable

Docs.summary: **Note: This API is now obsolete.** The non-obsolete alternative is . Applies the given in the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.BitmapEffect%2A> property to a specified region of the visual object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The following illustration shows an emboss effect applied to a portion of an image.
![An emboss effect on part of an image.](~/add/media/effectinput-centered-emboss.jpg "An emboss effect on part of an image.")

Docs.summary: **Note: This API is now obsolete.** The non-obsolete alternative is . Initializes a new instance of the class using the as the source for this input.
**Note: This API is now obsolete.** The non-obsolete alternative is . Gets or sets a rectangular region on the visual to which the is applied.
Docs.value: The rectangular region of the visual to which the effect is applied. The default value is <xref:System.Windows.Rect.Empty%2A>.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When the rectangle has a or equal to **0**, the effect will not be applied to the visual. expresses different behavior depending on whether the background of the element is transparent or not. If no background is present or defined, only considers the children for its size and the starting point for coordinates begin where the visual rendering starts. ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Windows.Media.Effects.BitmapEffectInput Clone() cil managed

Docs.summary: **Note: This API is now obsolete.** The non-obsolete alternative is . Creates a modifiable clone of this , making deep copies of this object's values. When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.
Docs.returns: A modifiable clone of the current object. The cloned object's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen%2A> property will be even if the source's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen%2A> property was

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Windows.Media.Effects.BitmapEffectInput CloneCurrentValue() cil managed

Docs.summary: **Note: This API is now obsolete.** The non-obsolete alternative is . Creates a modifiable clone of this object, making deep copies of this object's current values. Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.
Docs.returns: A modifiable clone of the current object. The cloned object's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen%2A> property will be even if the source's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen%2A> property was .

Docs.summary: **Note: This API is now obsolete.** The non-obsolete alternative is . Gets or sets the that is used for the input for the object.
Docs.value: The that is used as the input for the object. The default value is **null**.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Setting this property will replace the current visual with the given . Care should be taken as this can cause undesired effects. For example, if the Input is an and the object that applies the effect is a , the image will replace the textbox as the visual. ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
